content: A series of corrective actions were identified and implemented to simplify the process flow, reduce idle time and waste, and improve the control of output variability. These actions included eliminating the need for team approval of changes in the software system, providing technical and quality feedback on changes before review, reducing the time difference between review forums, consolidating technical expertise, creating a system for tracking the quality of changes and providing feedback, standardizing change templates, and automating the change process. These actions resulted in significant reductions in non-value-added time and improvements in the business process.
